intro: Pimelea mesoa subsp. macra, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pimelea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a shrub characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is part of the family Thymelaeaceae and is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh conditions. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal in native gardens.
